intro: Bellevalia trojana, commonly known as the Trojan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
